review: Bought the pro version. Not worth it. The create your own theme option is broken. Launcher only contains one basic gesture option. While Before Launcher is minimal, it isn't functional enough to buy the pro. Also, there's no option to change the font size of the app drawer. If these options are added, maybe it'll be a little better than it is now.
ras4vb: Bharat -- let us know if you need help getting a refund (if you aren't happy, we really want you to have your money back). The next release is in beta testing and will add more gesture support. You can change the app drawer font size, a little, via Android text/font size setting. Can you email us about the theme option? feedback@beforelabs.com

review: Great Work!! Almost perfect. Have had a great experience of using this minimal launcher. It would be perfect if it had a swipe down gesture to open the notification panel. Also, my work profile apps are not visible in the Apps drawer. Is it possible to add those? It will be an all-rounder if these 2 things can be achieved and I'll definitely purchase it then.
ras4vb: Gaurav - the Before Launcher is close to beta testing the Work Profile feature (Android for Work). Are you Interested in getting a first look? Email: feedback@beforelabs.com

review: Great app. Best minimal launcher out there. Have bought the Pro version as well. However, there are a load of bugs right now and it doesn't feel stable. Ex: 1. The icons for folders keep acting up, going all crazy. 2. First time I installed the app, it went into a crashing loop and refused to open. Had to install it again. 3. The themes menu is very glitchy. 4. Folders don't show up in sort by size, recents, or install date. 5. No option to sort apps in folders. 6. Renaming apps is glitchy.
ras4vb: Hi Shobit. According to Google, our app has been very stable. We haven't seen those issues you report. But we have a new release out that offers several fixes. Please email feedback@beforelabs.com about 4 and 5 on your list. We'd like to know more. Thanks!

review: I would love to use this app but I'm not seeing notifications on notifications panel. I'm using nokia 8.1 with Android 10. If you can help me out. Once you guys will fix the issue I will update ratings. You can contact me if you want any extra information for debugging. Edited: Thanks. It's working as expected now. I thought every notifications will be available on notifications panel but that's not the case(Tho it can be really handful feature.) Thanks. Keep it up.
ras4vb: Thanks for the feedback. On notifications: 1) Make sure device notification access setting looks like this: https://www.dropbox.com/s/xyal46gsgjvdwtq/Screenshot_20190731-210442.png?dl=0 and 2) Watch this short video about the notification filter: https://youtu.be/9egNkysFNrc. We can help more via email: feedback@beforelabs.com

review: I have 3 reviews because there is no gesture support, and I have to use the 3 buttons (back, home and recent apps) which is very, very difficult on large screens. Otherwise I would give it 5 stars. It does what it says, and I'm looking forward to decreasing my on-screen time from today :) Devs, please add gesture support for back, home and recent apps.
ras4vb: Hi - we support all types of navigation, three-button, two-button and gestures. Can you email us at feedback@beforelabs.com ? I'm sure we can figure this out. Please include your device and Android OS level. Looking forward to helping you. Thank you for taking the time on this feedback.

review: Love it! I have tried a bunch of minimal launchers, but this one takes the cake. One suggestion: Can we get an option to see the next calendar event at a glance? I use Calendar for almost everything, and it would be nice to see what the next event is. Thanks! Great work, btw. PS: Every app now has the same notification sound. I don't know why. Could you please fix that too?

Lovely. Minimalist launcher. Just what I was looking for. Does the job. Has a clean and well thought out interface. The notification filtering works well. You can set which apps are allowed to notify you. Also has a Do Not Disturb switch to pause all notifications at once. Enough color themes to get you through. Some form of black and white is all you need though. Install. Get your focus back. Get some work done. Pick a time to seive through all unimportant notifications. Peace.

This is a 'near perfect' app! It focuses your needs and gives a neat & clean experience. It's for those who likes simple yet useful things on their device. Though I've used 'near perfect' word, as there's always room for some development. I suggest to give it a scroll down feature to let one use the basic things like Data, Bluetooth, Torch etc. Keep up the work! üëç

Love the app. The ui, the compartmentalisation and preference based settings are just what i needed. And besides this, not only does it offer an ad free experience but also a clutter free one. The notification customisation feature is amazing. And so is the personal theme selection without being cringy or yuck. But the best part is, it has overall reduced my total phone usage and consumption. Although, if it had lock screen feature/settings too, that would be really cool too.

A different concept. I like it. But lacks polish. Fonts are too big. I would like an option to move the entire favourite app list to a position i find comfortable. Now it's way up at the top area. Notification page is a good idea. What about an ability to take actions for the notifications like reply or snooze from there? A home button gesture for a custom app would be nice. I use sesame search all the time. Would be nice if you can show the upcoming events in a minimal way somewhere there.
ras4vb: Praveen - thanks for this. We are working on new releases including a number of your ideas there...stay tuned. I think I can help with your questions on notifications: you can tap on a single notification to reply, swipe to dismiss, press-hold to change app filtering and of course, "clear all". More help/ideas?  Email us feedback@beforelabs.com

review: I really like the idea of decluttering your mobile with apps that we don't use everyday and notifications that aren't really important. I come from OnePlus launcher, and I miss certain features and these features will most probably keep the idea as it is. Certain gestures like double tap to turn off screen, swipe down to notifications and swipe up for search is very much needed. Also the sensitivity of the swipes seems off, if only I could change it . Overall will give 5 stars when changes come.

I love this app! If you really want to take control of your heavy phone usage then go for this launcher. The "filtered notifications" section is perfect as it stacks up all notifications so that I could review them later when I have the time. It just shows that the developers have created the exact solution to the problems they were facing with their phone usage, and that they really care about solving it. Keep up the work! :))

Your app does not understand the difference between 'Ringtone' and 'Notification' volume. It has clubbed both into Ringtone by itself. So even when my 'Notification' volume is set to 0%, it still makes sound when I get notifications. So I have to reduce the 'Ringtone' volume, at the cost of missing out on important calls. Please solve this issueüôè And I will definitely go premium.
ras4vb: Yash -- thank you for taking the time. Space here for devs is limited (email us: feedback@beforelabs.com ) but you can shut down unfiltered notification sound and vibration ( Setings -> Notification filter -> toggle switches ) It is in our roadmap to have more customizations here (including your request). Again, thanks for the feedback.

review: A couple of things will make this launcher one of best in the market. 1. Ability to hide certain apps from app list. 2. Ability to add widgets/Shortcuts on homescreen. 3. Icon support. 4. Search option should show results from Contacts, Google etc. Bug Noticed: When I go to app list and click on search option, I see a dark blue tint for a couple of seconds; regardless what background color I am using. I know this is a visual glitch and it looks ugly. Please have a look into it. Thank you!!

If you're the kind of person that knows what you use your phone for, this launcher is for you. Been using it for almost a year and it's REALLY good. Shows your most used app on the homepage, and a "news-feed" of "filtered notifications" to its left; you don't miss any notifications. The launcher UI is not ideal for tablets. I don't write app reviews ‚Äî this is my first ‚Äî but I've got so much out of this; I had to write! If you've read this far, consider trying the launcher out for a week :)

Great launcher. Aims at being clean and minimalist and accomplishes that with ease. One request to the developers though, the app transitions are a bit rough when I press the home button. Opening an app (any app) has a really nice fade sort of transition which works smoothly, but closing an app just abruptly takes me to the home screen without any transition and that looks very odd. Kindly fix this. (Using a Samsung SM-A505F, i.e Galaxy A50)
ras4vb: Hi Pulkit! We've updated the app animations in our latest release, and we feel like they are quite a bit smoother. Let us know what you think. If you have anything, please email feedback@beforelabs.com. Thanks!

review: Looks premium, lives up to the minimalist name. However, no matter what I do, this launcher fails to detect a single notification that hits my phone. As a result, the Notifications screen ALWAYS says "All clear!". By comparison, every other launcher I've tried (Nova, Lawnchair, Hyperion, Shade, Rootless, CPL, etc.) picks up all notifications, just as they should! The developers are super nice but they couldn't help me out either. I've given Before multiple tries over the months, but to no avail.
ras4vb: Hi Pranav. Okay. Strange. Apologies you are having trouble. If you can, can you send a screenshot of your notification access settings screen to feedback@beforelabs.com? Thanks again for your support.

review: No doubt amazing application, but only thing I want is a option to see all the apps in a grid. One more thing, that plus + button and a small popup is insanely annoying please remove it and add longpress or option in setting instead of annoying. Hope you consider my request. Update: + buttons gets removed after 8 apps, but I don't think just 8 and only 8 is good option there should be equal posiblity for less and more.

Been a user for couple of months now but recently something's off with the launcher. Might be something to do with ColorOS of Realme. When going back to homescreen, it switched back to system launcher. Then when you try to launch the Before launcher, it tells you to clear app data and won't let you open it until you do. All settings lost. Is there a feature in Pro version to backup and restore the settings? Will upgrade.
ras4vb: Hi Narinder. It seems like its the Realme ColorOs. Our app couldn't do that. On your related point, saving preferences to the cloud is a feature we are planning on delivering in the future.Thanks for the support!

review: Bought it as soon as I downloaded and installed it. Well thought approach aiming towards a Simple Android Interface. One request. It would be very convenient for us users, if there's a player interface when apps like Spotify, Gaana, JioSaavn etc. are run in the background. Otherwise, I have to access the Notification Drawer or the App to control the tracks. I don't know if this feature is already there in the settings. If yes , please guide, if no, Please add this.

This is wonderful. The app works smooth. Changing background option helped me save battery on AMOLED screen (by using black background). I wish there was a way to hide app icons on the app list view. Also, select any number of apps on the homescreen instead of 8. If less than 8, there appears an annoying consistent "Add app" button.

The experience of this app is definitely new for someone who has been using years of rich, vibrant launchers. I liked it for its functionality, though I am yet to ascertain i am using my phone less or same as earlier now. In the brief period of testing so far, i have observed the notification filter does not work that well. I still receive notifications from an app which is not in my filter list.

The recent apps window doesn't integrate well with the minimal theme background and coming home from apps is not a smooth transition, there are glitches in the app yet to be addressed. The notification s area is not working well on my OnePlus device. And I also request the developer to include an option to hide the drop down notification s(not the quick toggles). Hope the developer addresses this issue and come up with an update. Apart from this, the rest is fine and well developed.

This has been a very interesting launcher and I have been using it for 4-5 months now. It has definitely helped me focus on stuff and also is very user friendly. Few things that I would love to see as features is an option of grouping of apps inside the notification screen so that I can still look at them in a group and also another thing is to star a few apps. Then they can always be on the top of the screen.

I really like the launcher and have been using it for a while now, but the only thing that doesn't seem to be working is the notifications filter. None of the notifications show in the filtered notifications screen. I enabled notification access to the launcher and I tried the filtered on and off modes, yet no notifications show up.
ras4vb: Vijay: the filtered/unfiltered terminology caused us to make the following video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9egNkysFNrc   If that doesn't help, contact us at feedback@beforelabs.com    One more thing: make sure the Before Launcher is designated as the default "Home" app...you can do this in Settings or under your device settings. Thanks!

review: Loving the entire minimal approach to smartphones. Saves a lot of time from being distracted by filtering the notifications. The only thing I'd be focusing on improving at this moment is the typography and the iconography. The UX is smooth. UI can be a little more seamless.

Best launcher ever. Neat, Simple, Distractionless, No unwanted permissions required, No useless settings, Just awesome with minimal impact on RAM...Only thing I noted was that if we clear out recent apps, it flashes the default wallpaper and then only comes to the pinned apps. I believe that might be a bug or a permission issue, if the developer can take a look, it would be wonderful.
ras4vb: Hi Tharun. Thanks for the support! If you have a moment, is there any chance you can send a video of that bug to feedback@beforelabs.com... Or at least email over a bit more detail. I am having trouble reproducing the issue. Thanks again.

review: Perfect for me! Using my phone less with one. But probably for the calls only if the devs could change the colour after a call would be great! Since the calls are super important. (Just a thought) other wise it's great. The search app option instead of a keyboard an alphabetical order of letters of would be great.

Thank you for coming up with such an amazing launcher. This is by far one of the best launcher I have seen for stock android phones. Good job devs!! .. By the way, I have come across something that I believe could be sorted -- When I open an app and then close it, I still see some traces of the app's screen interface in the background of the launcher.

In love with this launcher. Minimalist design was what I was looking for. But this happens to be more useful. My favorite features: 1. Notification filter. This easily decluters my notification pane. 2. Easy one handed app list with search. Search results appear at bottom of screen, is my another favorite.

The best launcher indeed, I was trying out different launchers and this one is the best, most minimalistic launcher i have seen. The ONLY issue i am having is that you need to swipe thoroughly to switch from the main screen to all alls or notifications and vice-versa. It needs to be more smooth and sensitive in that regards. Other than that, ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê No doubt.

App is great. But notification filters is working exactly the opposite. I unfiltered 31 apps which means I want to get notified only from these 31 apps and rest app notifications to be filtered. But the notification area is showing only filtered app notifications. Edit- After watching the youtube video from the developer, I got the idea of filtered and unfiltered notifications. Thanks. Changed the rating to 5 star..

This launcher is undoubtedly the best minimal launcher I've found in the store. The pro plan is a bit too much ( for me ), but I want to request one feature and that is the ability to change the app open animation. The default is nice but it would be awesome to change it. Overall the launcher is great and I definitely recommend it to someone on the look for a minimal launcher and as a matter of fact I will STICK to this launcher from now on.

Would be amamzing to have following: 1. Ability to change font 2. Ability to have widget like clock at the top, and calender etc.. just the text widgets and remove the status bar as notifications are accessible from thr filter anyway Not any fancy that goes against the purpose of the app. These are something I liked in other apps with same purpose. Great work!!
ras4vb: Thanks for the support! Plenty of happy customers your device. We can get this working. 1) Please ensure Before Launcher is the default launcher? We don't want to filter if another is defaulted. 2) Please ensure notification access is granted. See the screenshot: https://www.dropbox.com/s/2gvfibrnbbwewa9/Screenshot_20190722-151338.png?dl=0

review: Please add double tap to lock screen. It will be more helpful for the users. Double tapping on the free space of the home screen will lock the screen and enables the fingerprint sensor for in display fingerprint scanner devices. When we click on the home button on our device, the screen goes blank for a second. I am using Realme X2 pro mah be the problem is Only with my device. Please fix this issue. Thank you üòä nice app interface ‚ù§Ô∏è

My current home screen. Thank you for making this app. I have some suggestions. there's this bubble to add apps that only goes away if we add 8 apps. if the important apps in my phone are just 5-6, this bubble always shows. it would be great if it is hidden even if the homescreen has less than 8 apps. then phone app should be placed at the bottom irrespective of other apps like in Lessphone launcjer. making phone calls is the wjole point of having a phone.
ras4vb: Hi Abu. Thanks for your support. We are working on making the homescreen a bit more flexible to support  how you want to use the before launcher. That said, we do have a bit different philosophy than some other launchers. We our smartphones to stay smart. Less distracting but still smart. Anything additional: feedback@beforelabs.com. Thanks!

review: Very impressed by this launcher. Im a big fan of Nova and wanted to try something new. I liked this launcher's minimalism and it looks great on amoled. I would personally like to see editable app names on main screen and a right or center alignment would be great as well. The notification filter is very underrated. I loved that feature. White icons to go with the app name would great too. Overall very happy with it.
ras4vb: Venu - thanks for the support. Glad to hear the minimal design and reduced distractions are working for you. We are just a few months away from releasing support for editable app names, icon packs and other features (see our Play Store listing). Email us with other thoughts at:  feedback@beforelabs.com

review: The best minimal launcher ever used. Even notifications are filtered by it based on apps. No hanging issue. Buy pro version for sure to support the team. Edited - launcher doesn't support app switching. Apps close down and tend to open again completely from start screen when we try to switch between apps. Please bring it ASAP. It's a big missing.
ras4vb: Jaideep -- sorry for the trouble on this. This is a new one to us and are hoping we can have a back/forth in email ( feedback@beforelabs.com ). Looking forward to helping you out with this.

review: The app is amazing. Been using it for almost 15 months now. Best minimalist launcher to opt for. At first, the pro version didn't seem to offer much over and above the free version but once I got it, it was totally worth it. Buy it! The features, the ease, the privacy..... Love it!

It's nice. Would be nice to have some gesture support. When we're in app drawer, a swipe down can trigger search function. When on homescreen, swipe up gesture can assistant / other app or action. Double tapping the black space can trigger "sleep" or other app etc. Swipe down gesture can be used to get another trigger. Also, it would be nicer to have the app switch to a dark theme based on time of the day / custom schedule / system dark mode.
